trans-unit.source: Consume packages
trans-unit.target: Consume packages

trans-unit.source: Beginner Programmer
trans-unit.target: Beginner Programmer

trans-unit.source: Open your project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Open your project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: !Note Game Studio will later support adding NuGet packages directly.
trans-unit.target: !Note Game Studio will later support adding NuGet packages directly.

trans-unit.source: First of all, after saving all your changes, open your project with Visual Studio. You can easily do this by clicking the appropriate button on the toolbar:
trans-unit.target: First of all, after saving all your changes, open your project with Visual Studio. You can easily do this by clicking the appropriate button on the toolbar:

trans-unit.source: Open project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Open project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Add a reference
trans-unit.target: Add a reference

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the project and click on Manage NuGet Packages...
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the project and click on Manage NuGet Packages...

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Start button
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Start button

trans-unit.source: For our example, let's use Stride.AssetPack.BuildingBlocks package:
trans-unit.target: For our example, let's use Stride.AssetPack.BuildingBlocks package:

trans-unit.source: Choose "nuget.org" or "All" as the Package source
trans-unit.target: Choose "nuget.org" or "All" as the Package source

trans-unit.source: Make sure Include prerelease is checked (if necessary)
trans-unit.target: Make sure Include prerelease is checked (if necessary)

trans-unit.source: Go to the Browse tab
trans-unit.target: Go to the Browse tab

trans-unit.source: Search for a Stride asset package (i.e. Stride.AssetPack.BuildingBlocks) and select Install
trans-unit.target: Search for a Stride asset package (i.e. Stride.AssetPack.BuildingBlocks) and select Install

trans-unit.source: Install package
trans-unit.target: Install package

trans-unit.source: Save the Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: Save the Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: Use assets in Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Use assets in Game Studio

trans-unit.source: In Game Studio, go to the File menu and select Reload project
trans-unit.target: In Game Studio, go to the File menu and select Reload project

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to see the referenced project and its assets in Solution explorer
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to see the referenced project and its assets in Solution explorer

trans-unit.source: Use package
trans-unit.target: Use package

trans-unit.source: !Note Those assets are readonly and as such can't be dragged and dropped into the scene. This will be fixed soon. In the meantime, you can still use the asset selector to change an existing model or material reference to one from the asset pack.
trans-unit.target: !Note Those assets are readonly and as such can't be dragged and dropped into the scene. This will be fixed soon. In the meantime, you can still use the asset selector to change an existing model or material reference to one from the asset pack.
